revised_title: Contagious Disease Among Milch Cows Near London in 1714: Suppression Methods and Findings
tldr: The author documents a contagious disease that affected milch cows near London in 1714 and describes the methods taken to suppress it, including the burning of sick cows, cleaning and smoking cowsheds, and restricting cow movement. The author also provides a brief account of the disease's symptoms and effects on the cows' internal organs.
